DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of substance holding a post procedural biospecimen in solution or suspension.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dulbecco's Phosphate-Buffered Saline Cell Culture Serum

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dulbecco's Phosphate-Buffered Saline Cell Culture Serum
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A buffered (pH range 7.2-7.6) saline solution used in cell culture applications.: The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

Concepts.definition: A buffered (pH range 7.2-7.6) saline solution used in cell culture applications.

The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Roswell Park Memorial Institute 1640 Medium Cell Culture Serum

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Roswell Park Memorial Institute 1640 Medium Cell Culture Serum
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sodium bicarbonate-buffered medium formulated for use in a 5-10% carbon dioxide atmosphere. It is used in the cell culture of human lymphoid cells.: The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

Concepts.definition: A sodium bicarbonate-buffered medium formulated for use in a 5-10% carbon dioxide atmosphere. It is used in the cell culture of human lymphoid cells.

The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium Cell Culture Serum

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium Cell Culture Serum
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A serum-free medium for supporting the growth of adherent mammalian cells. It contains a combination of 6 salts, 13 essential amino acids, and 8 vitamins and is intended for use in a humidified incubator where the air contains 5% carbon dioxide.: The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

Concepts.definition: A serum-free medium for supporting the growth of adherent mammalian cells. It contains a combination of 6 salts, 13 essential amino acids, and 8 vitamins and is intended for use in a humidified incubator where the air contains 5% carbon dioxide.

The serum blood fraction obtained from an animal that can be used as a component of growth medium or as a negative control or blocking agent to reduce background in procedures that assay molecular interactions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A serum-free medium for supporting the growth of adherent mammalian cells. It contains a combination of 6 salts, 13 essential amino acids, and 8 vitamins and is intended for use in a humidified incubator where the air contains 5% carbon dioxide.

Concepts.definition: A serum-free medium for supporting the growth of adherent mammalian cells. It contains a combination of 6 salts, 13 essential amino acids, and 8 vitamins and is intended for use in a humidified incubator where the air contains 5% carbon dioxide.
